skills.title: Front-End
skills.description: Through my coursework and personal projects, I have built a variety of websites, GUIs, and front-end applications. Each project has presented unique challenges that allowed me to refine my skills in modern web development. I have experience working with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React and React Native to create responsive and intuitive user interfaces.

skills.title: Back-End
skills.description: I have worked extensively with Java, C++, and JavaScript to develop efficient and scalable back-end systems. My experience includes building APIs, managing authentication, and integrating databases into web and mobile applications. I have also used technologies like Node.js and Firebase to support full-stack development, ensuring seamless communication between the front-end and back-end.

portfolio.title: Cockys Way - USC Campus Navigation
portfolio.description: Cockys Way is a React Native mobile application designed to help students navigate the University of South Carolina campus efficiently. The app features an interactive map, a staff directory, and a schedule tracker, using Firebase authentication to provide a personalized experience. The repository is not public yet.

portfolio.title: Nexus Project Management System
portfolio.description: Nexus is a project management tool designed for software engineering teams. It facilitates task management while integrating Scrum principles to improve workflow efficiency. The system includes features for sprint planning, backlog organization, and team collaboration.

portfolio.title: Dela-Where? Exploration Website
portfolio.description: 'Dela-Where' is an interactive website that highlights Delaware's historical significance while providing a comprehensive guide to local attractions and activities. The project was independently developed, focusing on both design and functionality to create an engaging user experience.
